qas.question: What was the house of king George II?
Name two diverse geographies that king George II had to protect.

answers.text: his commitments in Germany were counterbalanced by the demands of the British colonies overseas

qas.question: How anxious was France to assist Prussia to take over Hanover?

answers.text: it had no desire to divert forces to central Europe for Prussia's interest.

qas.question: Why would France want to invade Hanover?

answers.text: France was very much interested in colonial expansion and was willing to exploit the vulnerability of Hanover in war against Great Britain

qas.question: What was Britain's obligation to Hanover if colonial expansion via war with France was to be resumed?

answers.text: Hanover had to be secured against Franco-Prussian attack

context: The <a0_0>Hanover<a0_0/>ian king George II of Great Britain was passionately devoted to his family’s continental holdings, but <a1_0>his commitments in Germany were counterbalanced by the demands of the British colonies overseas<a1_0/>. If war against France for colonial expansion was to be resumed, then <a4_0>Hanover had to be secured against Franco-Prussian attack<a4_0/>. <a3_0>France was very much interested in colonial expansion and was willing to exploit the vulnerability of Hanover in war against Great Britain<a3_0/>, but <a2_0>it had no desire to divert forces to central Europe for Prussia's interest.
